content.full_text:
DMP title
Project Name
 My plan (KU Leuven DMP)
Principal Investigator / Researcher
 Tarik Roukny
Institution
 KU Leuven
1. Data Description
What data will you collect or create? Fill out the table below and/or describe.
 Type of data
Format 
 Volume
How
created? 
 Transaction level data on derivatives contract between
EU counterparties
 textual and
numerical
500GB
Regulatory
disclosure
Do you intend to reuse existing data?
Yes. This data is collected for financial supervision and research purposes under the European
Market Infrastrcuture Regulation and hosted by the European Securities and Market Authority. 
Do you use personal data (i.e. all data possibly identifying an individual)?
No
2. Documentation and Metadata
Describe the documentation that will be created for the data. This section deals with
the way in which you will document how the dataset was created and subsequently
processed.
The data used under this project is confidential and proprietary. Access is granted by the
European Securities and Market Authority (ESMA). Throughout the project we will document the
data processing as well as produce related data processing scripts under a git framework to
allow other researchers and policymaker to replicateand extend our analysis.However, most of
data processing and cleaning is done inhouse by the ESMA facility.
Describe the metadata for the data. This section deals with metadata: information
contained in your dataset about the research data.
No metadata envisioned at this stage.
3. Ethical, Legal and Privacy Issues
Are there any ethical issues concerning the creation and/or use of the data?
There are confidentiality issues that follow the legal EU framework followed under EMIR and
ESMA
Did you consider all issues about copyrights and IPR?
Yes. 
Are the collected data considered to be â€œdata containing personal informationâ€​
and are all the requirements about the collection of these data met?
No personal information data is collected
4. Data storage and Backup during Research
How and where will the data be stored during research?
Other, please specify:
Data is stored by the European Market and Securities Authority.
Which back-up procedures are in place?
Back up procedures are delegated to and implemented by the European Securities and Market
Authority.
Describe the data security procedures and who has access to the data.
Security procedures are delegated to and implemented by the European Securities and Market
Authority.
Access to the data is exclusively granted by the European Securities and Market Authority for
This document was generated by DMPonline (http://dmponline.dcc.ac.uk)
1 of 2
policy and research activity only.
5. Data selection and Preservation after Research
What is the long-term preservation plan for these dataset(s)?
Data is and will be stored by the European Securities and Market Authority with no termination
date.
 
Data Selection: Which data will have long time value for the research and will be
preserved?
All data handled in this project will have value for research and will be preserved with no
foreseen termination date.
6. Data Sharing
Are there any restrictions for sharing the data?
Data is extremely confidential. Its collection falls under the European Market and Infrastructure
Regulation.
Sharing access to replicate and extend the work done through the project will be granted at the
discretion of the institution hosting the data, that is, the European Securities and Market
Authority.
If there are no restrictions, which mechanisms will be in place to assure that the data
are discoverable, accessible and intelligible?
Question not answered.
How will you share the data?
Sharing access can only be done at the premises of the European Securities and Market Authority
in Paris with the insititution's own infrastructure and guidelines.
With whom will the data be shared?
On request
Sharing access to replicate and extend the work done through the project will be granted at the
discretion of the institution hosting the data, that is, the European Securities and Market
Authority.
7. Responsabilities and Resources
Who is responsible for Data Management during the project? This will be the person
who might receive questions on the data management aspects of the research
project.
The PI bears the end responsibility of updating & implementing this DMP.
Which additional resources are needed for the execution of the Data Management
Plan?
Authorisation from the European Securities and Market Authority
Did you read the KU Leuven Data Management Policy? (find the link to the policy in
the guidance).
Yes
This document was generated by DMPonline (http://dmponline.dcc.ac.uk)
2 of 2
